title: Safeguard Access, Empower Europe: Launching KR21’s Action Plan to Let Libraries be Libraries
content:
The mission of libraries is under threat. Not just from budget cuts or censorship, but from a “silent” crisis: a legal and market framework that is systematically stripping libraries of their right to function. Libraries are being written out of the digital age. It’s time to write them back in.

Today, Knowledge Rights 21 (KR21) launches a definitive roadmap to fight back: Safeguard Access, Empower Europe – An Action Plan to Let Libraries be Libraries.

title: The Political Science of Open Science
content:
This article summarises the results of a round-table discussion at the Science|Business annual conference held in Brussels on 4-5 February 2026. We are grateful for the engagement of other participants whose ideas have shaped what is presented here.

The European Research Area (ERA) Act, now due to be published in the 4th quarter of 2026, has been promoted as the main legislative game in town when it comes to making a reality of the freedom of circulation of knowledge throughout the EU. Advancing open access and open science are central to this goal.
